us.thetaco.banana.utils

Class BanCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.thetaco.banana.utils.BanCache

  • public class BanCache
extends java.lang.Object
    A cache of bans that will be updated along with the database. A much quicker method than waiting for the database
    Author:
    activates

    • Method Detail

      • addBannedUUID

        public boolean addBannedUUID(java.lang.String uuid,
                             java.lang.String message,
                             java.lang.Enum<DatabaseManager.BannerType> type,
                             java.lang.String bannerUUID)
        Adds a banned UUID to the cache. If the UUID is already banned, the process will be cancelled
        Parameters:
        uuid - The uuid to ban (in string form)
        message - The message to set with the ban (set to null if default should be used)
        type - The banner type (ie console player etc)
        Returns:
        Will return true if the UUID was banned. If it already banned, the method will return false

      • addBannedUUID

        public boolean addBannedUUID(java.util.UUID uuid,
                             java.lang.String message,
                             java.lang.Enum<DatabaseManager.BannerType> type,
                             java.util.UUID bannerUUID)
        Adds a banned UUID to the cache. If the UUID is already banned, the process will be cancelled
        Parameters:
        uuid - The uuid to ban
        message - The message to set with the ban (set to null if default should be used)
        Returns:
        Will return true if the UUID was banned. If it already banned, the method will return false

      • getBannerType

        public java.lang.Enum<DatabaseManager.BannerType> getBannerType(java.lang.String uuid)
        Used to find out what entity banned the player in question
        Parameters:
        uuid - The uuid of the player to check for
        Returns:
        Will return the BannerType enum for the player's ban type. Will return null if the player is not banned

      • getBannerTypeIP

        public java.lang.Enum<DatabaseManager.BannerType> getBannerTypeIP(java.lang.String address)
        Used to get the entity that banned the address in question
        Parameters:
        address - The address of the player to check for
        Returns:
        Will return the BannerType enum of the address' ban type. Will return null if none was found

      • getBanner

        public java.lang.String getBanner(java.lang.String uuid)
        Gets the banner of supplied UUID. Will return null if the banner wasn't a player or the player wans't banned at all
        Parameters:
        uuid - The uuid of banned player
        Returns:
        Will return the uuid of the banner if it exists and the banner was a player

      • getBannerIP

        public java.lang.String getBannerIP(java.lang.String address)
        Gets the banner of supplied IP. Will return null if the banner wasn't a player or the player wans't banned at all
        Parameters:
        address - The banned address
        Returns:
        Will return the uuid of the banner if it exists and the banner was a player

      • addFriendlyDate

        public void addFriendlyDate(java.lang.String s,
                            java.lang.String unparsedDate)
        Used to add the pure form of the date to the ban cache for the purpose of storing it in the database. This will help for making a more dynamic message to kick someone upon trying to join
        Parameters:
        s - A UUID or ip address.. just make sure you remember which one you put it under!
        unparsedDate -

      • getFriendlyDate

        public java.lang.String getFriendlyDate(java.lang.String s)
        Used to fetch the pure form of the stored date.
        Parameters:
        s - Either the UUID or ip address you used to store this dtate
        Returns:
        The unparsed date eg: 0:0:1:0 <-- 1 minute
